build_shelter.step_contents: 1. Search for a dry, flat area between 2 trees with splits in their trunks. Look around the area to find a relatively flat area with a tree that has a trunk that splits about 3–5 feet (0.91–1.52 m) off of the ground. If possible, try to find 2 trees that have a split in their trunks about 3–5 feet (0.91–1.52 m) off of the ground and are about 10 feet (3.0 m) apart from each other.  2. Find a branch 10 feet (3.0 m) long and 3–6 inches (7.6–15.2 cm) thick. To form your shelter you need a support beam, so look for a sturdy tree branch that isn't rotting. The straighter the branch, the better it will be for forming the structure of your shelter. Clear off any critters or spiders that may be on the branch. 3. Insert 1 end of the branch into the split of 1 of the trees. Where the tree splits and forms a “V” shape, place 1 end of the branch to hold it up as a support beam. If the tree doesn't have a split, use a log that ends in a “V” shape and lean it against a tree so the branch is supported by the tree. 5. Lean branches against the main branch to form the structure of your shelter. Gather a bunch of branches that are long enough to be propped up against the main branch of your shelter. Think about forming ribs with the branches. Try to keep them as close together as you can.  6. Lay twigs and leaves over the branches to form a layer of insulation. Once you've formed the structure of your shelter, use smaller, leafy branches, brush, or leaves to create a layer of insulation that will help retain heat and provide cover from the wind and rain. Lay the leaves and small branches over the frame in order of decreasing size to create a thick layer.  7. Use leaves to make a bed inside of the shelter. Try to make your shelter as comfortable as you can by finding soft material like leaves or pine needles and laying them on the ground inside of your shelter. Check for any insects or spiders on the material before you put it in your shelter.

branch: a branch 10 feet (3.0 m) long and 3–6 inches (7.6–15.2 cm) thick
branches: a bunch of branches that are long enough
leaves: soft material like leaves or pine needles

at: a relatively flat area with a tree
has_split_in_trunk: trees with splits in their trunks
trees that have a split in their trunks
thick: a branch 10 feet (3.0 m) long and 3–6 inches (7.6–15.2 cm) thick
has_bug: any critters or spiders that may be on the branch
any insects or spiders on the material

clear_spider: Check for any insects or spiders
Clear off any critters or spiders
insert_beam: Insert 1 end of the branch into the split of 1 of the trees
place 1 end of the branch to hold it up as a support beam
lean_branches: Lean branches against the main branch to form the structure of your shelter.
propped up against the main branch of your shelter
layer: Lay twigs and leaves over the branches to form a layer of insulation
use smaller, leafy branches, brush, or leaves to create a layer of insulation
Lay the leaves and small branches over the frame
add as many layers as you can
Use leaves to make a bed inside of the shelter
laying them on the ground inside of your shelter

eat_plants.step_contents: Forge for edible wild plants. There are lots of wild plants in the woods that you can eat, but you need to make sure you're gathering ones that aren't toxic. Look for dandelion leaves, the green leaves of chickweed and wood sorrel, and the tender young flowers of primrose and wild violets. If you're not sure what plant you're picking, don't eat it. Wash off any edible plants that you find.

water: Wash off any edible plants that you find
leaves: dandelion leaves, the green leaves of chickweed and wood sorrel
flowers: the tender young flowers of primrose and wild violets

unwashed: Wash off any edible plants that you find

build_snare.step_contents: Build a snare if you have string or wire. A snare is a safe and relatively easy way to catch small game like rabbits and squirrels. Take a piece of wire or string about 2.5 feet (0.76 m) long, make a loop at one end and tie a slip knot. Then push the opposite end of the string or wire through the slip knot to form a large circle. Hang the circle of the snare over a footpath or a trail in the woods. Make a horizontal bar over the ground with a branch to hang your snare. Look for a small, beaten path that was made by an animal to place your snare.

at: over a footpath or a trail in the woods
made_by_animal: a small, beaten path that was made by an animal

make_snare: Take a piece of wire or string about 2.5 feet (0.76 m) long, make a loop at one end and tie a slip knot. Then push the opposite end of the string or wire through the slip knot to form a large circle
make_horizontal_bar: Make a horizontal bar over the ground with a branch to hang your snare
hang_snare: Hang the circle of the snare
Set up as many snares as you can

survive_in_the_woods.wikihow_title: How to Survive in the Woods

item.description: a general type of things that are essential to solve a problem

water.description: water that can be collected from the environment and used to wash things

tree.description: a tree that can support a shelter

branch.description: a sturdy tree branch that isn't rotting

branches.description: a bunch of branches that are long enough to be propped up against the main branch

twigs.description: leafy branches used to create a layer of insulation that will help retain heat and provide cover from the wind and rain

beam.description: a long, sturdy branch inserted into the split of tree that supports the roof of shelter

frame.description: ribs of the shelter forming the structure

wire.description: a piece of wire or string about 2.5 feet (0.76 m) long

snare.description: a trap for catching birds or animals

direction.description: a course along which character moves

location.description: a particular place or position in game

go.prerequisites: The player is at location 1. Location 1 is connected to location 2 in the direction and this connection is not blocked.
go.results: The player is no longer at location 1 and is at location 2 now.

get.description: pick up an item and put it in the inventory
get.prerequisites: The player and item are in same location.
get.results: Item appears in the player's inventory and no longer in the location environment.

get_water.description: get water from a location that has a water source like a lake
get_water.prerequisites: Player is at a location that has a water source.
get_water.results: The player's inventory has untreated water.

drop.description: drop down an item and remove it from the inventory
drop.prerequisites: The player is at a location where the item does not exist. The player's inventory contains the item.
drop.results: The item is no longer in player's inventory and is at the location.

clear_spider.description: clear off any critters or spiders that may be on the branch or leaves
clear_spider.prerequisites: The item in player's inventory has a bug on it.
clear_spider.results: This inventory item does not have bug on it.

insert_beam.description: insert end(s) of the branch into the split(s) of the tree(s)
insert_beam.prerequisites: The player is at a  flat and dry area with a tree that has a split in its trunk. The player has a long and thick branch in their inventory with bugs removed.
insert_beam.results: The player and a beam are at this area and the branch is no longer in inventory.

lean_branches.description: Lean branches against the main branch to form the structure of your shelter.
lean_branches.prerequisites: The player is at the location where the beam is at and has a bunch of branches in their inventory.
lean_branches.results: A frame of shelter appears at the location where player stands. The

layer.prerequisites: The player is at the location where the frame is at and has twigs and leaves in their inventory. Leaves are clean without bugs.
layer.results: A shelter appears at the location where player stands. The twigs and leaves are no longer in inventory.

wash.description: Wash off plants that you find.
wash.prerequisites: Player has item and water in inventory and the item is unwashed.
wash.results: The item in inventory is washed.

eat.prerequisites: The player is hungry and has something edible in inventory. The item is washed.
eat.results: The item is no longer in inventory and the player is not hungry.

make_snare.description: Take a piece of wire and make a large circle
make_snare.prerequisites: The player has wire in inventory.
make_snare.results: The wire is no longer in inventory. An snare that has not been hanged is in inventory.

make_horizontal_bar.description: Make a horizontal bar with a branch to hang your snare
make_horizontal_bar.prerequisites: The player has a branch in inventory.
make_horizontal_bar.results: The branch is no longer in inventory and the bar is in inventory.

hang_snare.description: Hang the circle of the snare over a path
hang_snare.prerequisites: The snare has not been hanged and is in inventory. The wooden bar is in inventory as well. The player is at a location where there is a small, beaten path that made by an animal.
hang_snare.results: The snare is hanged over the path made by animal.

has_water_source.description: this location has a source of fresh water

treated.description: the water has been decontaminated by boiling it

at.description: an object is at a location

inventory.description: an item is in the player's inventory

connected.description: location 1 is connected to location 2 in the direction

blocked.description: the connection between location 1 and 2 in currently blocked

has_split_in_trunk.description: this tree has split in its trunk

has_bug.description: the branch or leaves has bugs

unwashed.description: the item has not been washed off

made_by_animal.description: this is a small, beaten path that made by an animal
